reviews.review_msg: Margaret is a nice person, however the course itself is just brutal! Her exams were quite hard and she expected a lot even though the material was very difficult to understand. This course is not about memorizing, you need to apply your knowledge and really understand the concepts and theories. mt and final are open book, m/c and essay.
I put in the normal amount of work and did not do well. I usually am an above average student and this was not the case in all THREE classes I have taken with her. 317 last year and 335/338 this sems

The negative reviews are exaggerated. Amy is not the best prof but she is not bad at all. There is nothing to prevent you from doing well if you actually study and ask questions if you're confused. The course content is hard, but she posts lecture recordings AND gave the opportunity for extra credit. I put in a normal amount of work and got an A.

Amy is a nice prof, allows cheat sheets and extra credit. However, she says that lecture is a class discussion but tends to talk about things that don't really make sense. Beware, her quizzes and midterm are based on class discussion and there is a lot of reading u must do.
She is a really harsh marker! GPA killer

I don't know why there are so many negative comments about Amy! Her lectures are so interesting. You just need to pay attention to what she's saying during the lecture to fully understand the readings. The course content itself is hard. But she posts lecture recordings, so you can always go back and review them. I recommend taking classes with Amy.

I will never forget the amount of stress this class caused me. She is an extremely hard grader. I struggled so much in this class. I wish I never took this class with her, my GPA is going to be ruined. Please take any prof besides her. She assigns so many confusing readings and expect you to understand them all in depth. The exams are so hard too.

Amy tries to make us look at things more critically, and I definitely learned to be more attentive to detail by taking this class, but if English is not your first language or you get distracted easily, her classes are difficult to follow. The slides are useless, she mostly talks (FAST) and that's what your notes will be. Grading can be harsh too.

Amy sucked at teaching this course. she was all over the place. only good thing was that some cases overlapped from 335 so those were easy to understand but otherwise I would not recommend taking this course.

I have taken several classes with Professor Conroy, and her classes are very engaging and I recommend attending the lectures in-person for discussions! She is open to concerns and questions, and provides clear instructions on how to reach the grade you desire. Stay caught up with the readings and lectures if you want to do well and ask questions!

I want to cry. I have never been this stressed in all of my years at SFU. Her exams and quizzes are incredibly difficult. She words them in such confusing ways, it's like she wants her students to not do well. Save yourself the stress and do not take any class with her. I wish I listened to the reviews on here.

TA SAM WAS THE BEST. This is the most stressed I have ever been in a semester. gives us only 4 days to work on a take home exam which is worth so much of our final grade AND cumulative! some of us cannot book off work and need more than 4 days to complete an exam. took two classes with her this semester and I am honestly fried

Probably the worst professor of my undergrad. I had to take her 3 times so it's not just one course. She is clearly ideologically possessed and is dismissive of challenges to what she says. She will rarely answer a question honestly and will ridicule you or distract you by changing the subject or by using jargon. Also, her slides are useless. 0/10.

I think Amy gets a bad rep from students. She definitely cares about students and lets the final be take home and you can have a cheatsheet during the midterm which is a lifesaver. However, she can be a difficult grader on the first assignment and expect you to know some details you may think are a bit unfair.

The course content is interesting, however, Amy makes it impossible to demonstrate what you learned. The exam was one hour with 15 mc and 20 written where she expected paragraph answers to the written question (the questions themselves were long so it took a minute to even READ the question). I do NOT recommend if you care about your grades.

Exams really easy (95% based on lecture, with some stupid specific Q's), but unclear grading criteria on assignment. Make sure you reply to many people for tutorials or you'll lose many marks. Don't bother with textbook other than to skim for context. Lectures were <50 minutes/week. Didn't get much out of the class. TA was not great either.

Amy only provides you pre-recorded lectures where she speaks so illiterately fast that it makes it impossible to take accurate notes. She will test you on the tiniest details she verbally mentions in those recordings since there is ZERO info on her slides, meanwhile I cannot grasp a word she is saying. She has a horrible teaching system.
